page.title: 01Location
page.content: This block covers an area to the south - west of the Bedford - Kempston urban area.The majority lies on a ridge of boulder clay which runs north - south along the county boundary rising from 200 feet to 340 feet.The area is drained by two brooks, tributaries of the River Ouse which drain to the north - east and join the river at Kempston Church End. The District Council boundary cuts diagonally across the area, the area to the north - east is administered by North Bedfordshire Borough Council and that to the south by Mid - Bedfordshire District Council.The area includes parts of the parishes of Wootton, Cranfield and Marston Moretaine in scattered farms (about 12) the only concentration of population being part of Cranfield in the south - west and Upper Shelton.
